Kaizen_title: Review and Reassess Standing Operation Process at FAR & HF
background: Standing operation process which categorized as a static standing is required to use anti fatigue mat as a control measure to reduce fatigue. However, according to further review and observation, none of the process at East Plant is really static standing. ,Anti fatigue mat may introduce a greater hazard when the implementation is improper, such as potential slip, trip, and fall.,Other than anti fatigue mat, site can review and decide other control measure based on the Hierarchy Risk Control
baseline: Current process which identify as standing process which required anti fatigue mat are standing process at Plastic assembly area, Heat Fusion, FAR, Blister Sealing, Auto Blister, JIT Line, Auto Grooming, Hot Melt Gluing. (Reference: EHS/GL/629 - EHS Procedure "Use of Anti Fatigue Mat")
issue: Berdasarkan hasil stand and observe di proses FAR & HF,  berdasarkan hasil interview pada populasi responden diketahui bahwa kedua proses tidak masuk dalam kategori static standing,Anti fatigue mat tidak dalam posisi yang cukup ideal untuk mengcover area pergerakan pekerja FAR, sehingga terdapat bagian kaki yang tidak menginjak mat saat bekerja. ,Berdasarkan interview terhadap responden diketahui bahwa Lantai FAR licin saat terdapat benang jatuh, dengan adanya anti fatigue mat benang lebih terlihat dan mudah diambil. Tanpa anti fatigue mat lantai menjadi licin.,Pekerja mengenali keluhan fatigue pada kaki, penyebab, dan pencegahannya. Misalnya: pekerja paham resiko bekerja pada posisi berdiri di HF ebih lelah dibanding di FAR karena sifat pekerjaan dan mobilisasi selama bekerja. Pekerja mengetahui bahwa bergerak dapat membantu menghilangkan fatigue. Namun pekerja belum memahami gambaran secara umum tindakan pencegahan yang dilakukan tersebut dari perspektif ergonomi,Prosedur mengenai anti fatigue mat dan Risk Assessment belum direview untuk merefleksikan kondisi aktual standing process di FAR dan HF

Kaizen_title: IDEKU - Reduce the Cost of Producing Nest Sealing Box
baseline: We maintain control over the entry of new toys by standardizing the shim-plate database. Kaizen_title: PPE Requisition review and system improvement
background: Currently, PPE requisition released from each area will be routed to EHS to obtain EHS review and acknowledgement. This process need further review to identify if the current process still relevant and value added
baseline: All PPE requisition released from each area will be routed to EHS to obtain EHS review and acknowledgement. ,Employee asked to fill PPE acceptance form,Employee acceptance and MR form will be a data source to be entered in database PPE
issue: Form persetujuan penggunaan PPE saat ini tidak digunakan secara optimal dan standard. Misalkan: penggunaan form secara kolektif, sedangkan format form adalah untuk perseorangan,Terdapat ketertundaan submission dan approval MR, khususnya pada permintaan yang masuk pada hari Jumat sore atau sabtu,Belum terdapat data kapan request masuk dan kapan request diapprove,Data Persetujuan penggunaan PPE West Plant dikirimkan setiap 2 hari sekali lalu di key in oleh EHS admin di East Plant,Database PPE belum optimal dengan informasi jenis PPE dan tanggal permintaan PPE, karena data-data yang masuk belum semua dikey in oleh karena informasi tidak jelas (Nama dan KPK tidak jelas/ tidak lengkap, PPE yang diminta tidak terbaca),Data headcount tidak terupdate ,KPK New hire belum ada saat permintaan PPE disubmit,Form MR yang sudah diapprove, saat ini dapat diambil oleh siapapun dan berpotensi disalahgunakan,Terdapat perbedaan practice untuk proses flow pemeriksaan data request PPE oleh admin EHS 1 dan admin EHS 2. Admin EHS 1 melakukan pemeriksaan kondisi PPE dan pemeriksaan data, sedangkan admin EHS 2 tidak melakukan pemeriksaan, namun langsung ke tahap approval oleh EHS Engineer

Kaizen_title: PD - IDEKU - Standardize 1806 Window Box Thickness
baseline: There was 2 types of window thickness (RPET 0.17 mm & RPET 0.24 mm) for 5-car pack packaging which the usage is targeted max. 50% each yearly.
issue: There was 2 types of window thickness (RPET 0.17 mm & RPET 0.24 mm) for 5-car pack packaging which the usage is targeted max. 50% each yearly. The RPET 0.24 will be use only when a broken PET window happens on RPET 0.17 during FEP and PP. However, in 2023, the usage of RPET 0.24 mm increased to 9 out of 17 SKU# which was above the limit.

Kaizen_title: SP - Reduce transportasi di proses rework
baseline: 5x bolak-balik ke paint mixing untuk mengambil cat
issue:
Penempatan cat untuk rework touch up menggunakan polybag
Root cause:
Belum ada botol khusus touch up untuk rework,Adanya transportasi 5x bolak-balik ke paint mixing untuk mengambil cat
Root cause:
Pengambilan cat dilakukan saat toy yang datang (15 Toy dengan kedatangan Toy bergantian) ,Cat sering kering saat akan melakukan touch up sehingga harus beberapa kali menambahkan cairan MEK  (CT: 5s x 28 cat)=140s
Root cause:
Penempatan memakai polybag dan dalam keadaan terbuka,Potensi terkena audit traceability
Root cause:
Tidak ada proses scan traceability cat untuk rework,Pemborosan cat di proses rework 
Root cause:
Cat yang selesai di pakai di buang dan polybag bocor

Kaizen_title: Noise control at Manual Die Cut
background: Currently noise exposure at manual die cut process detected above the limit (80 decibel), especially from certain type of fabric. Noise generated from this process need to be controlled to ensure less exposure to the operator or person works nearby
baseline: According noise measurement at machine Die Cut no, 10 on Jun 6, 2023/ 09:16 AM, noise exposure from this process is 118.5 dB. Another measurement at machine Die cut no. 11, noise exposure is 94.9 dB.
issue: Noise exposure from manual die cut may exposed to other worker/ visitors at the area. ,Current risk control is still focused on PPE and administrative. No engineering/ design control implemented to control the noise exposure,Current noise exposure at manual die cut when the specific fabric run is higher than standard. However, there is no institutionalized controlled at the process (Risk assessment, PPE matrix, and sign is not updated),Noise exposure from manual die cut machine which proceed certain fabric type show a significant value. This exposure is able to be detected in 1 - 3 meters radius from the machine.

Kaizen_title: Improve Monitoring Data Long Illness
background: Beberapa pekerja yang telah sakit berkapanjangan sempat masuk bekerja tanpa beberapa hari sebelum dinyatakan sehat dan laik bekerja oleh pihak yang berwenang.
baseline: Terdapat 5 pekerja yang masuk kembali pada saat telah memasuki sakit berkepanjangan namun belum dinyatakan sehat dan laik bekerja dari pihak Medis.
issue: Karyawan long illness belum dinyatakan laik bekerja dan melakukan clearance dengan alasan cuti dan bukan sakit, tetapi sudah masuk kerja,Belum ada monitoring kesehatan karyawan yang dilakukan oleh IHCL saat karyawan menjalani long illness ,Kendala yang dialami oleh team IHCL dalam mengetahui kondisi karyawan yang sedang dalam status long illness,Karyawan sudah long illness tetapi IHCL tidak mengetahui riwayat sakitnya, karena karyawan tsb berobat diluar IHCL sehingga (in case) pada saat karyawan meninggal dunia IHCL tidak mengetahui riwayat sakitnya,Belum ada notifikasi untuk reminder ke IHCL, HRA & IR terkait dengan karyawan yang mempunyai riwayat sakit berkepanjangan dan perlu istirahat yang cukup lama, sehingga ada kemungkinan terlewatnya update pengupahan karyawan long illness kepada team finance,Belum ada standard atau agreement untuk semua dokter IHCL, untuk menentukan karyawan laik bekerja karyawan after long illness

Kaizen_title: Cut resistant gloves review: type. quality.and improvement towards better safety protections
background: 1. Potential worn out PPE still used by employees due to issue during PPE replacement flow process,2. Cut resistant gloves are easily degrade and required changes
baseline: 1. Current PPE request raised by employee through recorder or leader using Material request form and approve by EHS,2. Cut resistant gloves replacement period has not clearly defined for west plant operation as west plant part may create the gloves easier to degrade compare to parts running at East Plant,3. There are several type of cut resistant gloves at West Plant Operations that need to review and assess if its quality is good enough for existing process
issue: There are potential delay from PPE requisition flow at West Plant, where the operator will raise the needs of PPE to the leader, and leader will proceed the request at noon. The form then sent to supervisor for approval. When the supervisor is at another shift the approval will finished the day after,Potential delay during the approval stage at EHS. The approval may took 2 until 3 days.,Inadequate system to define clear schedule to replace cut resistant gloves,Inadequate cut resistant quality on existing cut resistant gloves, especially at the process where frequently contact with sharp edges, such as racking and de-racking process at VUM.,Inadequate knowledge on the PPE awareness. According to the interview, employee not fully understand the impact of using broken/ worn out PPE

Kaizen_title: PIM - Penumpukan part untrimming 20%-140% pada PN 11027-78402, PN HCD29-2009, PN 11027-80867, PN 11028-28948, PN 12028-09863
background:
1. Terjadi penumpukan part untrimming 20%-140%
2. Kondisi line tidak kondusif (berantakan)
3. DSA tidak tercapai
baseline:
1. PN 11027-78402 part untrimming 50%
2. PN 11027-78349 part untrimming 140%
3. PN 11027-80867 part untrimming 30%
4. PN 11028-09863 part untrimming 20%
5. PN 11028-28948 part untrimming 80%
issue:
Terjadi penumpukan part untrimming 20%-140%.
SOP trimming 1 gate 2 detik plus 2 detik untuk ambil dan buang runner disetiap shot. 1 jam 3600 detik.
1. PN 11027-87402. Target 1200 pcs/jam. 1 shot : 4 cavity,8 gate. HC FC 1.
 - 3600 detik / { (8x2 detik) + 2 detik } x 4 cavity = 800 pcs setiap jam.
Jadi, actual butuh HC 1,5,2. PN 11027-78349. Target 1029 pcs/jam. 1 shot : 4 cavity,16 gate. HC FC 1. - 3600 detik / { (16×2 detik) + 2 detik } x 4 cavity = 424 pcs setiap jam.
Jadi,actual butuh HC 2,4,3. PN 11027-80867. Target 2057/jam. 1 shot : 8 cavity,8 gate. HC FC 1. - 3600 detik / {(8x2 detik) + 2 detik} x 8 cavity = 1600 pcs setiap jam.
Jadi,actual butuh HC 1,3,4. PN 11028-09863. Target 514 pcs/jam. 1 shot : 2 cavity,4 gate. HC FC 0,5.
 - 3600 detik / {(8x2 detik) + 2 detik} x 8 cavity = 1600 pcs setiap jam.
Jadi,actual butuh HC 1,3,5. PN 11028-28948. Target 1440 pcs/jam. 1 shot : 4 cavity,8 gate. HC FC 1,1.
 - 3600 detik / {(8x2 detik) + 2 detik} x 4 cavity = 800 setiap jam.
Jadi,actual butuh HC 1,8

Kaizen_title: People and Material Flow - New Building Moving Plan
background: New Building moving plan requires robust preparation for people and material flow
baseline: 2021 People and Material Flow Kaizen
issue:
Team Warehouse (Raw Material, Subcon Part, and Equipment) concerns:
1. All raw material + molded part equipment standardization (including quantity)
2. Material Handling transaction process and location
3. Lift operation safety and process flow
4. Quarantine area
5. Receiving process flow
6. Floor leveling regarding material transportation
7. Charging and Equipment parking
8. Racking/locator visual,Team Production material (Output, WIP, Tool Storage, and Equipment) concerns:
1. All output equipment standardization (including quantity)
2. Floor marking
3. Spiral operation process flow
4. AGV operations + track installation
5. Towing operations + capacity
6. Tooling process flow (pit stop and tooling transaction)
7. Bin and master carton in-out area + process
Green Lane (KB area),Team People Flow concerns:
1. Employee arrival at POS 3
2. Waiting area
3. Clock in–out barcode installation
4. Safety basic regarding to people (visual, emergency exit, route, stair, safety meeting point) 
5. All people equipment needed (toilet, lactation, first aid corner, canteen + food supply & waste, mushola, office and pantry)
6. Paging/communication installation
7. Room meeting management
8. Janitor management

Kaizen_title: Legionella Monitoring Program
background:
Legionella sampling plan need to be review and reassess to allow optimum legionella monitoring program.,Legionella sampling result has been reported out with no further review and investigation to prevent further legionella growth.
,Legionella hazards and risk for high potential employee was not fully controlled and monitored to maintain employee’s health
baseline:
No specific legionella assessment to all potential sources to define proper sampling point
Legionella sample was taken in non-potential source which is not required to be sampling based on Mattel EHS Standard of legionella Monitoring program (i.e Air Handling Unit)
,No specific guideline for PTMI Legionella Monitoring program
Legionella sampling, lab analysis and report out, site analysis and action plan, remediation, resampling, and closure
,Inadequate technical knowledge regarding overall legionella monitoring program.
Including potential sources identification, legionella growth prevention, and other risk control
issue:
Cooling Towers is being sampling at each unit, while the source is coming from similar point. 
,Air handling unit identified as potential legionella source.
,Current risk assessment is not detail and comprehensive. It was not concluded which source is required to be sampling or not
,Current chemical treatment was done by using chemical agent supplied by 3rd party (PT. Anugerah Tirta Mandiri).

Kaizen_title: External Lab Testing Arrangement Flow
background: Each division with Quality arrange external lab testing with various purpose while Currenly budget for external lab testing within Quality Department is centralized in Lab budget, unless market specific request that will be charged back to specified marke,There were redundant testing submitted to external lab and tested internally at PTMI lab,Outstanding payment from external lab due to unclear responsibility who will paid the invoice
baseline: There were several lab testing  (Recent case: ISTA 6 testing and decopac) sent directly to external lab and resulted incomplete report, over testing result and outstanding to be paid for long time.
issue: Multiple sender for external lab arrangement within Quality department while cost budget centralized in lab budget, difficult to monitor and close the payment,Unclear PIC for external lab testing arrangement and payment,No standardization how to keep external lab test report to be accessed easily since multiple sender for external lab,Different practice lab record for external lab among Chemical Lab and Mechanical Lab, while Mechanical Lab didn’t record external lab test with internal logbook submission,Redundant/Incomplete testing to external lab with inhouse lab testing due to unclear information for overall testing plan of play feature toys,Redundant/Incomplete testing to external lab with inhouse lab testing due to submitted by supplier/MGPA for various reason (tight development time and/or investigation testing, etc.),There are several special testing required qualification, currently no gate at PA for QC to submit the special testing (Refer to Table 3 GQMP 2100)

issue: Posisi cutter dan clamper tidak proper karena standardnya seharusnya menjepit > memotong . Aktual : Memotong > menjepit. ,1. Cutter kurang tajam (pengukuran?) , 2. Cutter masih memiliki gap ,Jarak Looper dan Benang Jauh Karena dari changeover mekanik sulit mendapatkan looper yang sesuai (tidak ada stock). 2. Benang tidak benar2 tersangkut dengan jarum 3. 5S di workshop ,Selang angin tidak terkoneksi karena 1. Sengaja di lepas 2.Terlepas karena nipple tidak mencekam dengan baik 3.Ada lipatan di salah satu sisi selang sehingga menghambat dan terlepas dari selangnya ,Sensor benang habis otomatis mati karena ,Ceramic alur benang (kuningan) tidak lengkap terpasang,Lifetime gripper tidak termonitor karena tidak ada parameter untuk mengukur lifetime,Suction ada yang berbentuk tembereng ada yang bebentuk setengah lingkaran . Tidak standard,Revolver keramik pecah,Beberapa benang tidak masuk ke dalam sensor dan nyangkut (MC 213) karena Sensor benang yang kotak sudah tidak proper karena membuat benang terikat dan keluar dr jalurnya. Belum ada std tertulis. ,Mesin mati,1.Looper tidak menarik benang 2.benang menggulung ke looper,Benang Menggulung, Benang terbang,Salah penggunaan size looper,Missing stitches,Saat proses penggantian benang di revolver benang tidak tegang dan tidak terambil oleh gripper dan missing,jarum masih menusuk padahal tidak ada benang,Tarikan benang berat,Benang terbang ,Tusukkan bisa numpuk jika suction terlalu rapat,Tarikan benang berat,Tersangkut gripper dan menggulung,Approve sample dengan output berbeda

Kaizen_title: VBA TO LINK DIE CUT & SEWING FORM WITH INFO BOM SEWING (29 mar)
background: INFO BOM Remarking is still manually created by copy paste information from "Die Cut & Sewing Form".,Button embedded in previous "Die Cut & Sewing Form" was linked to tool list only and forgotten to be clicked.
baseline:
1) SGE & DC fill Sewing & Die Cut Form.
2) Each SGE copies and pastes all information then, arranges it in separated table from Sewing & Die Cut form to INFO BOM Remarking.
3) Each SGE fills fabric description in INFO BOM REMARKING Form.
4) SGE save as the INFO BOM REMARKING form and Sewing & Die Cut Form using combination of toy number dan today date as file name.
5) SGE will email to respective Textile Engineer to fill fabric width and justify the fabric description.
6) DC Engineer needs to fill the cutting method which the method has been filed in FMEA Sewing.
7) After the method has been filled, DC Engineer will email the respective technician.
issue: Email sending INFO BOM to Textile Engineer & Die Cut Engineer is still manual.,Save as the Sewing & Die Cut Form is still manual.,Save as the INFO BOM Remarking is still manual.,INFO BOM Remarking is still manually created by copy paste information from Die Cut & Sewing Form.,Different perception between machine type in sewing and die cut.,Copy FMEA date between Sewing & Die Cut.

Kaizen_title: IC - Regrind process Control
baseline: X % unproper regrind
issue:
No Proportional Valve standardization,-No layout segregation between mixing area and preparation area 
(RESIN MIXING AREA) 
-un-mix material are sent to production line,Preparation material not suitable to composition,MH regrind put the grind (from production area) directly to drum/hopper (the proper is return to remix area first),Racking system in remix staging improper inventory control (virgin, mixing, grind),Hopper flushing is done by MH Grind ,Material Contamination (arm acetal) line F,variation of flush material (relate to racking system issue),Runner ratio > actual FC,No UOM identification (Kg) in staging for the harvest material (panenan) 
current condition (1 bag = 1 pcs),-Locator accuracy not 100% (zonk)
-no identification for masterbatch,No SOP for mixing material,Cleaner for mixer especially glittre material (PP),Reject Material from layering defect (PIM)  reused for regrind material,Virgin Material identified as harvest (panen) material

Kaizen_title: 5S Audit System Improvement
background: Different perspective of 5S audit system in each area.
baseline: 5S audit report 2022
issue:
Different understanding to conduct 5S audit in each area.,Inconsistent implementation of 5s (only a few areas achieve a perfect score and maintain it) and there are many repeated findings.,There is no visualization of the best area/machine as a benchmark for doing 5s,There is no audit system for 5s audits in the office yet,Lack of 5s awareness 
- there is no measurement/record of the value added that has occurred due to the improving 5s,There is no standard level scoring yet (previously it was only based on 5s value whether it increase/decrease ).,The assessment of each 5s point is potentially different depending on the auditors understanding,Lack of awareness and implementation of 5s in all areas is uneven

Kaizen_title: Indexing Document HRA
background:
1. Pencarian dokumen yang sulit jika ada Audit.
2. Indexing dan Filling dokumen yang kurang terstruktur, membuat masalah pada point 
3. Sebagian masterfile karyawan kontrak / PKWT (Perjanjian Kerja Waktu Tertentu) dan diangkat menjadi karyawan permanent / PKWTT (Perjanjian Kerja Waktu Tidak Tertentu) masih tersimpan di area P2S2 dan belum dikirim ke area East Plant.
5. Terdapat masterfile karyawan kontrak / PKWT (Perjanjian Kerja Waktu Tertentu) masih berada di area Personnel Office East Plant.
baseline:
1. Terdapat dokumen yang tidak dikembalikan ke compactor Personnel Office / Mezzanine setelah audit, di periode tahun 2021.
2. Ditemukan dokumen Personnel Action (PA) tahun 2015 di compactor Mezzanine dan belum discrap.
3. Dokumen dari tahun 2020 masih tersimpan di area P2S2 dan belum discrap.
Waktu yang dibutuhkan untuk mencari dokumen membutuhkan waktu lebih dari 15 menit.
4. Masterfile karyawan permanent / PKWTT (Perjanjian Kerja Waktu Tidak Tertentu) tahun 2017 s/d 2021 yang berada di compactor area Personnel Office tidak tersusun sesuai urutan KPK.
issue:
Tidak tercantum penulisan KPK pada masterfile, sehingga penulisan KPK masih dilakukan manual (ditulis menggunakan pensil)

,Semua Masterfile permanen sudah tidak terupdate

Kaizen_title: Standardization of Gas Trolley at Gas Storage East Plant

baseline: Score EHS Patrol WE 2/18 = 92 %
issue: Lebar plate penampang tabung gas pada trolley tidak proper, karena ukuran gasnya berbeda-beda sehingga tidak mengcover seluruh bagian bawah tabung gas ,Kondisi hook untuk strap tabung gas tidak proper karena kondisinya tidak mengait dengan kuat,Kondisi rantai pengait tidak proper, karena ada sambungan menggunakan kawat dan pegas,Jumlah pengait/strap hanya 1 dibagian atas, sehingga saat loading dengan type gas yang pendek contohnya acetyiliene pengait tidak mengcover bagian tabung gas  (hanya terikat dibagian cap valve),Belum terdapat guideline dan check list penggunaan trolley,Kondisi  wheelcock/penahan roda tidak aman, karena terdapat bagian yang tajam

Kaizen_title: Safety Improvement at Packout - Process involving rubber band to attach part on the insert
background: Potential abrasions on operator fingers due to repetitive contact with rubber band during the process,Complexity of the process which required dexterity become a challenge in the past years to introduce proper finger protection,Use of rubber band is still unable to be eliminated at this moment. ,Potential "iceberg phenomenon" which still wait us to review, assess, and define the best corrective and preventive action
baseline: Historical abrasion injury on operator's finger due to repetitive contact with rubber band,Use of first aid finger tape to cover and protect operator finger from repetitive contact with rubber band
issue: Pada roses yang menggunakan rubber band, ketika dilakukan secara frequent berpotensi menimbulkan abrasi pada kulit jari tangan operator. Namun resiko tersebut belum dikontrol dengan baik. Pekerja menggunakan medical band aid tape untuk mencegah tangan abrasi.,Belum terdapat dokumentasi yang baik atas hasil trial dan evaluasi pada jenis finger coat yang ada di PC Item PTMI, untuk proses-proses yang menggunakan rubber band ,Penggunaan medical band aid tape memiliki potensi bahaya penyalahgunaan tape untuk tindakan penanganan cedera incident di area kerja, sehingga kejadian incident berpotensi tidak terlaporkan dengan baik.,Standarisasi finger protection akan menimbulkan potensi timbulan sampah tape yang berpotensi tidak disegregasi dan kelola dengan baik

Kaizen_title: IQC Supplier Performance Monitoring
background:
- There is no document to monitor Supplier GRN vs RN Performance
- MGPA ask for monthly supplier GRN RN performance,MGPA ask for Monthly supplier GRN RN performance
baseline: Currently IQC don’t have a document for collecting and measuring each supplier GRN vs RN performance.
issue:
Very high loading to match GRN & RN per month. There are average of 25K GRN incoming which need to be paired with average of 370 RN in per month based on 2021 data
,RN has different disposition depending on severity of the reject which affect GRN acceptance calculation. UAI and AOD is considered accepted while RTV, Sort/rework, SQM, and SQV is reject
,Date format data from AS400 is not compatible for excel formula. AS400 use date format “YYMMDD”
,Incomplete supplier/subcontractor monthly performance because 1 supplier/subcontractor may have more than 1 vendor code,High loading to manually calculate each vendor performance. There are more than 150 supplier/subcontractors name with 186 vendor code with average of 25K GRN and 370 RN per month

issue:

Tutup ink cup tidak terpasang sempurna karena dibutuhkan udara untuk sirkulasi ,Ink cup leaking dibagian atas

Belum ada standard pengisian paint sehingga saat mesin running paint berpotensi tersembur kebagian atas,Ink cup leaking dibagian atas

Kurangnya kepedulian akan kebersihan ink cup leaking dibagian atas,Ink cup leaking dibagian atas ditemukan hampir 100% di proses ink cup CMYK

Ink cup CMYK diganti hanya saat ink cup sudah aus/rusak sehingga banyak terdapat kotoran paint yang sudah mengering dan sulit dibersihkan,Ditemukan tutup ink cup tidak tertutup dengan sempurna potensi ink cup leaking
Root Cause:
Ulir ink cup sudah loose karena life time (sering buka tutup) atau ulir tersumbat oleh paint yang sudah mengering

Kaizen_title: New Toy Loading Kaizen
background: For years, ntp team has no visibility to see new toy loading which is coming to PTMI. We just realize after FPR done and see the loading not balance, too high in July-Sept month . ,So we must re-balance in the short time, call / send emails to internal and external team and send new sch to re-commit to fit our loading (pull in and push out orig cmmt date / FPR date) ,Based on above concerns, starting Nov 2020 ntp trying to calc the loading but based on sku only then adding NPI (new product introduction – weight of complexity) and chart . So we can see the loading and commit the date based on current loading.,The calculation of the loading is under excel pivot ,The report split by : Piloting Stage (FEP, PP, PS), SKU and NPI count, by week, month and year
baseline: too much time to doing calculation and must copy into the report - using diff file
issue: NULL

Kaizen_title: Kaizen 555 - IRIS Improvement and Integration Plan to IHCL Management System
background: IRIS Application has gone a trial and implementation since mid of 2022. We obtained a great benefit coming from this application, as well as opportunity to improve. This kaizen is conducted to improve and enhance the applications, also prepare the integration of this applications to the server and IHCL Management System
baseline: IRIS Applications and the performance during Mid 2022 - Q3 2023
issue: There is non value added waiting time identified in current system. Report is after draft report being reviewed by Lead Doctor and after that send by the in-charge doctor,Potential waiting time/ late response due to report reviewer is not assigned to specific doctor,Similar name of leaders make the In charge Doctor difficult to verify which one is the correct one. ,There is no filter of non-work related vs work related incident in existing IRIS form,Different link of IRIS with other applications used by IHCL Team. This condition may create non value added time to open other link instead of using one stop application,IRIS application is not integrated yet into server. During the trial the application is unable to be used due to the power off ,Current email sender of IRIS application is still using (Noreply-iris@mattel.com)

Kaizen_title: Incident Reporting & Notification System
background:
Incident reporting and notification flow need to be review and improve to :
1. Ensure immediate and comprehensive reporting
2. Prevent duplication of basic data interview to injured person by different person 
3. Prevent bias information by optimizing golden time of data retrieval on injured person memory
4. Standard reporting and notification
5. Data alignment EHS & IHCL
baseline: NA
issue:
Potential missing or different information obtained during the interview with injured person due to less guidance and structured questionnaire/ form
,Manual emailing system by Inhouse Clinic Doctor. Data manually key in from logbook into the email.
,Data recorded by Inhouse Clinic Team and data analysis by EHS is not fully align
,Different investigation report redactional between one area and another due to non guided questions on fact of investigations section

Kaizen_title: Kaizen 555 – System Improvement on Current Pre-Employment Specific Medical Check Up
background: Current pre-employment specific medical check up system is not adequate enough to ensure specific MCU being conducted in timely manner and fulfill regulatory and other customer requirement.
baseline: Specific MCU conducted after employees join the process,Employee movement information is not optimized yet to triggered MCU - Specific MCU requirement,Specific MCU database is now kept by EHS and IHCL. It is not optimized yet to generate personal MCU history, trend, and action plan.,Mandatory requirement to report MCU to government after the MCU finish. However, non integrated system might create potential missing reporting due date (max 2 month after MCU)
issue:
Pre-employment specific MCU has not been conducted due to employee working assignment has not defined yet during the pre-employment general medical check up. 
,Employee movement has not considered during the periodic specific medical check up to ensure pre-employment and baseline are able to be generated before employee working at the new location with hazardous exposure (e.g., Noise exposure and Chemical Exposure)
,Post employment specific MCU has been started, however there are still some room for improvement, such as ensuring communication chain about EOC information has properly informed within related parties (e.g., Planner, production, Recruiter, IHCL, and EHS)
,
Specific MCU – Outcome analysis:
Specific MCU result (data integration, analysis, and follow up) has not properly conducted to generate related occupational health program.
Mandatory reporting requirement has no specific system and reminder to control reporting adherence
,No specific process flow established as a reference to conduct specific medical check up Pre employment periodic and post

Kaizen_title: Hardgate Non-Retainable Packaging to Prevent HE & PH Mis-Testing
background: Non-retainable items that was previously used in non-retainable SKUs (example: mainline toy), is later used in Retainable SKU (example : collector toys), which will impact on compliance testing of non-retainable items, since all collector parts must be a retainable items.
baseline: No hardgate to check if non-retainable packaging items is only used inside mainline toy, or also collector toys (retainable),Non-Retainable Packaging is tested with QSOP 5000 (Environmental - Packaging Heavy Elements),Retainable Packaging is tested with QSOP 3600 (Heavy Elements), QSOP 3610 ( Plasticizers) or RMS 2901 for Surface Coating parts (Surface Coating Materials) which was tighter requirements than QSOP 5000
issue: Need to check with commodity & subcommodity is categorized as Non-Retainable Packaging and Retainable Packaging,No method to ensure if Retainable SKU's uses non-retainable packaging items,Ensure method of communication between QE (R+ who recognized if SKU is retainable / not) with IQC (R+ who recognized if PN# is retainable/not based on commodity-sub commodity)

Kaizen_title: VBA for LKP & PO Sewing Schedule Generator
background:
1) Schedule always generated manually by Sewing Stagging.
2) The SG Operator tends to have sudden scheduling as she needs to wait the information from Stagging Operator/Sewing Technician.
baseline:
Before :
1) Stagging operator check PO Schedule
2) Stagging operator will create the schedule manually by copy paste each PN from AS400 and PO date
3) Stagging operator will inform SG team the schedule weekly,After : Stagging operator and SG Operator can check the schedule weekly by using the macro instantly. The data directly linked to the Planner Schedule and the PN is linked to the SGE Performance website.
issue: Late bring out the outputs, because SGE material handler only depends on the triggers given by the technicians and staging leader.,Taking output too early ; adding workload when its not needed,No template to generate automatically for LKP & PO in SGE

Kaizen_title: End-of-Line MIDC (Auto Assosrtment) ANP
background: Currently MIDC load is 3.1 MM cars per week. 80% of that capacity is for 5-car pack product, assortment 1806. MIDC has 9 auto pack machines in the production line, each with a cycle time 6.5s. Manual operators assort 12 packs from 9 autopack machines and put it to the master carton within 9 s/master carton.
baseline: The proposal aims develop and provide an automatic assortment system for the Hot Wheels 5-car pack product. This system will comprise a conveyor system and an auto cartoning system, aimed at enhancing the efficiency and productivity of the packaging process for the Hot Wheels 5-car pack product. Additionally, the proposal includes reducing the cycle time of autopack machine from 6s to an impressive 4.2s. With this enhanced cycle time, it can fulfill the total production load with 6 machines, a substantial decrease from the current 9 machines.  The total investment required for this project is USD 180K, with a projected return on investment of 1.2 years.
issue: select a vendor for system implementation,Prepare new system design ,Prepare new system design,Prepare new system design,Prepare new system design,Prepare new system design ,Prepare new system design

Kaizen_title: FAR - Improve Rooted Head Scrap Process and Tools at FAR area
background: There is a risk of the product to be reworked and sold by irresponsible parties.,High CT to scrap (10 sec / Head)
baseline: current tools only making holes in both eyes
issue:
Accumulated output gets stuck and does not fall into the hole, causing extra time needed to clean the passageway.
,Output may occasionally fall further from the hole, requiring the operator waste time on picking it up and throwing it back.
,The yellow box used for taking rooted heads can only contain 80 pcs, requiring the operator to refill multiple times.
,Repetitive pinch gripping due to small handle, which may lead to fatigue and discomfort to the fingers.
,Inefficient input flow which requires both hands to work, resulting in unnecessary movements

Kaizen_title: Improve Training Process
background: Materials or procedures that are explained repeatedly,Time ineffectiveness,The possibility of material that accidentally forgot to explain,Some important procedures just using paper to explain, and it lack clear instructions or step
baseline:
PTMI is a big company, more than 5000 employees who need to always update their knowledge.
One of the digitalization steps is in the form of educational videos or visual animated.
Make it easier for employees to remember or find it out again some material that forgets a certain procedure.
The operational effectiveness of the company becomes simpler.
Increased employee staff experience.
Reduce paper waste.
Video or animated visuals are timeless.
PTMI maintains a private database of educational videos related to its own factories..
issue:
- Materials or procedures that are explained repeatedly. 
- Time ineffectiveness. 
- The possibility of material that accidentally forgot to explain.
- Some important procedures just using paper to explain, and it lack clear instructions or step.
